docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Sinen is a toolkit for creative coding.

docs.title: Feature
docs.text:
• Intuitive writing in the Lua programming language
  • Sinen is Written in C++
  • Using Vulkan API
  • Lightweight

docs.title: Hello world in Sinen as a library
docs.text:
local hello_texture = {}
local hello_font = {}
local hello_drawer = {}

-- Create a texture
hello_texture = texture()
-- Create a draw2D
hello_drawer = draw2d(hello_texture)
-- Create a font
hello_font = font()
-- Load a font from file(96px)
hello_font:load("mplus/mplus-1p-medium.ttf", 96)
-- Render text to texture
hello_font:render_text(hello_texture, "Hello Sinen World!",
    color(1, 1, 1, 1))
-- Set scale to texture size
hello_drawer.scale = hello_texture:size()

function update()
    -- Draw
    hello_drawer:draw()
end

docs.title: Build commands
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/astomih/sinen.git
cd sinen
git submodule update --init --recursive

docs.title: Visual Studio 2022
docs.text: Run "build/generate_vs2022.bat" and open&build the generated solution file(build/msvc/.).

docs.title: Editor(Experimental)
docs.text: Editor is a tool for creating and editing Scene files.

docs.title: C++ API
docs.text: Native API docs is available in Doxygen. https://astomih.github.io/sinen/doxygen/

docs.title: vector2(x, y) -> vector2
docs.text:
• x: The x component of the vector.
  • y: The y component of the vector. Create a vector2 object.

docs.title: vector3(x, y, z) -> vector3
docs.text:
• x: The x component of the vector.
  • y: The y component of the vector.
  • z: The z component of the vector. Create a vector3 object.

docs.title: color(r, g, b, a) -> color
docs.text:
• r: The red component of the color.
  • g: The green component of the color.
  • b: The blue component of the color.
  • a: The alpha component of the color. Create a color object.

docs.title: texture:load(string)
docs.text: string: The path to the texture. Load a texture from a file.

docs.title: texture:fill_color(color)
docs.text: color: The color to fill the texture with. Fill the texture with a color.

docs.title: texture:blend_color(color)
docs.text: color: The color to blend the texture with. Blend the texture with a color.

docs.title: font:load(string)
docs.text: string: The path to the font. Load a font from a file.

docs.title: font:render_text(texture,string, color)
docs.text:
• texture: The texture to render the text to.
  • string: The text to render.
  • color: The color to render the text with. Render text to a texture.

docs.title: draw2d
docs.text: draw2d is a class that draws 2D images.

docs.title: draw2d:user_data_at(integer, float)
docs.text:
• integer: The index of the user data.
  • float: The value of the user data.

docs.title: draw2d:add(vector2,float,vector2)
docs.text:
• vector2: The position of the image.
  • float: The rotation of the image.
  • vector2: The scale of the image.

docs.title: draw2d:at(integer, vector2,float,vector2)
docs.text:
• integer: The index of the image.
  • vector2: The position of the image.
  • float: The rotation of the image.
  • vector2: The scale of the image.

docs.title: drawui
docs.text: drawui is a class that draws UI images.

docs.title: drawui:user_data_at(integer, float)
docs.text:
• integer: The index of the user data.
  • float: The value of the user data.

docs.title: drawui:add(vector2,float,vector2)
docs.text:
• vector2: The position of the image.
  • float: The rotation of the image.
  • vector2: The scale of the image.

docs.title: drawui:at(integer, vector2,float,vector2)
docs.text:
• integer: The index of the image.
  • vector2: The position of the image.
  • float: The rotation of the image.
  • vector2: The scale of the image.

docs.title: draw3d
docs.text: draw3d is a class that draws 3D images.

docs.title: draw3d:user_data_at(integer, float)
docs.text:
• integer: The index of the user data.
  • float: The value of the user data.

docs.title: draw3d:add(vector3,vector3,vector3)
docs.text:
• vector3: The position of the image.
  • vector3: The rotation of the image.
  • vector3: The scale of the image.

docs.title: draw3d:at(integer, vector3,vector3,vector3)
docs.text:
• integer: The index of the image.
  • vector3: The position of the image.
  • vector3: The rotation of the image.
  • vector3: The scale of the image.

docs.title: camera:look_at(vector3, vector3, vector3)
docs.text:
• vector3: The position of the camera.
  • vector3: The position to look at.
  • vector3: The up vector. Look at a position.

docs.title: camera:perspective(float, float, float, float)
docs.text:
• float: The field of view.
  • float: The aspect ratio.
  • float: The near plane.
  • float: The far plane. Set the perspective of the camera.

docs.title: camera:orthographic(float, float, float, float, float, float)
docs.text:
• float: The left plane.
  • float: The right plane.
  • float: The bottom plane.
  • float: The top plane.
  • float: The near plane.
  • float: The far plane. Set the orthographic projection of the camera.

docs.title: music:load(string)
docs.text: • string: The path to the music. Load music from a file.

docs.title: music:set_volume(float)
docs.text: • float: The volume to set the music to. Set the volume of the music.

docs.title: sound:load(string)
docs.text: • string: The path to the sound. Load sound from a file.

docs.title: sound:set_volume(float)
docs.text: • float: The volume to set the sound to. Set the volume of the sound.

docs.title: sound:set_pitch(float)
docs.text: • float: The pitch to set the sound to. Set the pitch of the sound.

docs.title: sound:set_listener(vector3)
docs.text: • vector3: The position of the listener. Set the position of the listener.

docs.title: sound:set_position(vector3)
docs.text: • vector3: The position of the sound. Set the position of the sound.

docs.title: model:load(string)
docs.text: • string: The path to the model. Load a model from a file.

docs.title: random:get_int_range(integer, integer) -> integer
docs.text:
• integer: The minimum value.
  • integer: The maximum value. Get a random integer in a range.

docs.title: random:get_float_range(float, float) -> float
docs.text:
• float: The minimum value.
  • float: The maximum value. Get a random float in a range.

docs.title: window.rename(string)
docs.text: • string: The name to rename the window to. Rename the window.

docs.title: window.resize(vector2)
docs.text: • vector2: The size to resize the window to. Resize the window.

docs.title: window.resized() -> bool
docs.text: Get whether or not the window has been resized.

docs.title: window.set_fullscreen(bool)
docs.text: • bool: Whether or not to set the window to fullscreen. Set or unset the window to fullscreen.

docs.title: renderer.set_skybox(texture)
docs.text: • texture: The texture to set the skybox to. Set the skybox texture.

docs.title: renderer.clear_color() -> color
docs.text: Get the clear color of the renderer.

docs.title: renderer.set_clear_color(color)
docs.text: • color: The color to set the clear color to. Set the clear color of the renderer.

docs.title: renderer.at_render_texture_user_data(integer, float)
docs.text:
• integer: The index of the user data.
  • float: The value of the user data. Shader user data for the render texture.

docs.title: scene.load(string)
docs.text: • string: The name of the scene to load. Load a scene from data/scene/.

docs.title: scene.main_camera() -> camera
docs.text: Get the main camera of the scene.

docs.title: scene.get_actor(string) -> actor
docs.text: • string: The name of the actor to get. Get an actor from the scene.

docs.title: scene.resize(vector2)
docs.text: • vector2: The size to resize the scene to. Resize the scene.

docs.title: collision.aabb_aaabb(aabb, aabb) -> bool
docs.text:
• aabb: The first AABB.
  • aabb: The second AABB. Check if two AABBs are colliding.

docs.title: What is Sinen?
docs.text: Sinen is toolkit for creative coding. The goal is to be able to write intuitively in Lua.

docs.title: Hello World in Sinen
docs.text:
local hello_texture = {}
local hello_font = {}
local hello_drawer = {}

function setup()
    hello_texture = texture()
    hello_drawer = draw2d(hello_texture)
    hello_drawer.scale = vector2(1, 1)
    hello_font = font()
    hello_font:load(DEFAULT_FONT, 128)
    hello_font:render_text(hello_texture, "Hello Sinen World!", color(1, 1, 1, 1))
end

function update() 
    hello_drawer:draw()
end
